inference:
The measure of arc $BQ$ is $42^\circ$.
The measure of arc $QD$ is $38^\circ$.
The measure of arc $BCD$ is the sum of the measures of arc $BC$, arc $CD$, and arc $DB$.
Since $B, C, D$ are on the circle, the sum of the measures of the arcs $BQ$, $QD$, $DC$, and $CA$ is $360^\circ$.
The measure of arc $BD$ is the sum of the measures of arcs $BQ$ and $QD$, which is $42^\circ + 38^\circ = 80^\circ$.
Angle $P$ is an exterior angle of quadrilateral $BPDQ$, which is formed by intersecting chords $BD$ and $AC$ at $P$.
The measure of angle $P$ is equal to half the sum of the measures of the arcs intercepted by angle $P$.
$m\angle P = \frac{1}{2}(m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC}) = \frac{1}{2}(80^\circ + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC})$
Angle $Q$ is an exterior angle of quadrilateral $ABCD$, which is formed by intersecting chords $AC$ and $BD$ at $Q$.
The measure of angle $Q$ is equal to half the sum of the measures of the arcs intercepted by angle $Q$.
$m\angle Q = \frac{1}{2}(m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC}) = \frac{1}{2}(m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC})$
The sum of the arcs is $360^\circ$.
$m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC} = 360^\circ$.
$m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BQ} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{QD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CA} = 360^\circ$.
$42^\circ + 38^\circ + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CA} = 360^\circ$.
$80^\circ + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CA} = 360^\circ$.
$m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD} = 360^\circ - m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD} - m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC}$
$m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD} = 360^\circ - (m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DB})$.
$m\angle P + m\angle Q = \frac{1}{2} (m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD} + m\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC}) = \frac{1}{2} (360^\circ) = 180^\circ$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{180}$
ground_truth: We have that $\angle P = (\text{arc } BD - \text{arc } AC)/2$ and $\angle Q = (\text{arc } AC)/2$.  Hence, $\angle P + \angle Q = (\text{arc } BD)/2 = (42^\circ + 38^\circ)/2 = \boxed{40^\circ}$.

inference:
Let $m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BQ}) = 42^\circ$ and $m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{QD}) = 38^\circ$.
Since $B, C, D$ are on the circle, $m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD}) = m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BQ}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{QD}) = 42^\circ + 38^\circ = 80^\circ$.
$m(\angle P) = \frac{1}{2} (m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC})) = \frac{1}{2} (80^\circ + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC}))$.
$m(\angle Q) = \frac{1}{2} (m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC})) = \frac{1}{2} (m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC}))$.
$m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BQ}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{QD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DC}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CA}) = 360^\circ$.
$42^\circ + 38^\circ + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DC}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CA}) = 360^\circ$.
$m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{DC}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{CA}) = 360^\circ - 80^\circ = 280^\circ$.
$m(\angle P) + m(\angle Q) = \frac{1}{2}((m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD})) + (m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC})))$
$= \frac{1}{2}(m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC}))$.
By the property of angles formed by intersecting chords, $m(\angle P) + m(\angle Q) = \frac{1}{2}((m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AC}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BD})) + (m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{AD}) + m(\stackrel{\Large\frown}{BC})))$.
The sum of the four arcs is $360^\circ$.
$m(\angle P) + m(\angle Q) = \frac{1}{2}(360^\circ) = 180^\circ$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{180}$
ground_truth: We have that $\angle P = (\text{arc } BD - \text{arc } AC)/2$ and $\angle Q = (\text{arc } AC)/2$.  Hence, $\angle P + \angle Q = (\text{arc } BD)/2 = (42^\circ + 38^\circ)/2 = \boxed{40^\circ}$.
